name: clientapi
description: This is a first draft TypeScript/JavaScript API to the REST WebServer API. It demonstrates how to interact with the REST API from a client. Please refer to the actual REST API for an authoritative source of truth, as this Client API is an example that is not necessarily maintained.

scripts.build: (tsc clientAPI.ts --target es6) || $(./node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc clientAPI.ts --target es6) ; npm run post-build
scripts.post-build: sed -i'.bak' '/exports.__esModule/d' clientAPI.js && sed -i'.bak' 's/exports\[\"default\"\]/module.exports/g' clientAPI.js && sed -i'.bak' -e '/require\(.*interfaces\/.*\)/d' clientAPI.js && sed -i'.bak' -e '/import.*interfaces\/.*/d' clientAPI.js ; rm clientAPI.js.bak
scripts.build-populateDB: (tsc populateDB.ts --target es6) || $(./node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc populateDB.ts --target es6) ; npm run post-build-populateDB
scripts.build-populateDB-es5: (tsc populateDB.ts) || $(./node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc populateDB.ts) ; npm run post-build-populateDB ; npm run post-build
scripts.post-build-populateDB: sed -i'.bak' '/exports.__esModule/d' populateDB.js && sed -i'.bak' 's/exports\[\"default\"\]/module.exports/g' populateDB.js && sed -i'.bak' -e '/require\(.*interfaces\/.*\)/d' populateDB.js && sed -i'.bak' -e '/import.*interfaces\/.*/d' populateDB.js && sed -i'.bak' 's/\[\"default\"\]//g' populateDB.js ; rm populateDB.js.bak
scripts.examplePromises: (tsc populateDB_usingPromises.ts --target es6) || $(./node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc populateDB_usingPromises.ts --target es6) ; npm run post-build-populateDB_usingPromises
scripts.examplePromises-es5: (tsc populateDB_usingPromises.ts) || $(./node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc populateDB_usingPromises.ts) ; npm run post-build-populateDB_usingPromises ; npm run post-build
scripts.post-build-examplePromises: sed -i'.bak' '/exports.__esModule/d' populateDB_usingPromises.js && sed -i'.bak' 's/exports\[\"default\"\]/module.exports/g' populateDB_usingPromises.js && sed -i'.bak' -e '/require\(.*interfaces\/.*\)/d' populateDB_usingPromises.js && sed -i'.bak' -e '/import.*interfaces\/.*/d' populateDB_usingPromises.js && sed -i'.bak' 's/\[\"default\"\]//g' populateDB_usingPromises.js ; rm populateDB_usingPromises.js.bak

author: Riyad Shauk
